pullRequest.title: Issue #7567: Adding code examples for default configuration of MethodNameCheck
pullRequest.bodyText: Issue #7567: Adding code examples for default configuration of MethodNameCheck

nodes.bodyText:
You had to put code example for default configuration.
The default configuration is one without any other property.
This is not the default configuration since it has format property being explicitly written.
This is the default config:
<module name="MethodName"/>

Take help from here: https://checkstyle.sourceforge.io/config_naming.html#MethodName
See what are the default values for each property and then make some code examples accordingly.
If its an example of default config then write it below Line no. 85 in this file, since there you have to add code examples of default config.
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -137,6 +137,25 @@ * } * *

+ * An example of the default configuration for all methods: + *

+ * 
+ * <module name="MethodName">
+ *    <property name="format" value="^[a-z](_?[a-zA-Z0-9]+)*$"/>
+ * </module>
+ *
+ *

Code Example:

+ * 
+ * class MyClass {
+ *   public void first_Method1() {} // OK
+ *   protected void second_Method2() {} // OK
+ *   private void Third_Method3() {} // violation, name 'ThirdMethod' must match
+ *                                 // pattern '^[a-z](_?[a-zA-Z0-9]+)*$'
+ *   void Fourth_Method4() {} // violation, name 'FourthMethod' must match
+ *                          // pattern '^[a-z](_?[a-zA-Z0-9]+)*$'
+ * }
+ *
+ *

nodes.bodyText:
These names doesn't align to default MethodNameCheck.
Since underscore is not allowed in default config.
Use should only use CamelCasing for naming methods here.
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -83,6 +83,17 @@ * 
  * <module name="MethodName"/>
  *
+ *

Code Example:

+ * 
+ * class MyClass {
+ *   public void first_Method1() {} // OK
+ *   protected void second_Method2() {} // OK
+ *   private void Third_Method3() {} // violation, name 'ThirdMethod' must match

nodes.bodyText:
This is not the default pattern.
The default pattern is:
"^[a-z][a-zA-Z0-9]*$"
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -83,6 +83,17 @@ * 
  * <module name="MethodName"/>
  *
+ *

Code Example:

+ * 
+ * class MyClass {
+ *   public void first_Method1() {} // OK
+ *   protected void second_Method2() {} // OK
+ *   private void Third_Method3() {} // violation, name 'ThirdMethod' must match
+ *                                 // pattern '^[a-z](_?[a-zA-Z0-9]+)*$'

nodes.bodyText:
Please change:
name 'ThirdMethod' must match // pattern '^[a-z][a-zA-Z0-9]*$' to
method name must match to default pattern "^[a-z][a-zA-Z0-9]*$"
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -2001,6 +2001,17 @@ class MyClass {

<module name="MethodName"/> + +

Code Example:

+ +class MyClass { + public void firstMethod1() {} // OK + protected void secondMethod2() {} // OK + private void ThirdMethod3() {} // violation, name 'ThirdMethod' must match + // pattern '^[a-z][a-zA-Z0-9]*$'

nodes.bodyText:
This name is same as the above relative to the format.
If you are adding one more example than add it with some different style, like you could use _ or other similar mistakes with naming methods.
Also, add a public/protected/private modifier here.
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -2001,6 +2001,17 @@ class MyClass {

<module name="MethodName"/> + +

Code Example:

+ +class MyClass { + public void firstMethod1() {} // OK + protected void secondMethod2() {} // OK + private void ThirdMethod3() {} // violation, name 'ThirdMethod' must match + // pattern '^[a-z][a-zA-Z0-9]*$' + void FourthMethod4() {} // violation, name 'FourthMethod' must match

nodes.bodyText: remove 2 from end. It is obvious from the 1st example that you could use number with methodnaming, so rest should be more cleaner in look.
